title: Lennie Rosenbluth, Who Led North Carolina to a Title, Dies at 89
description: With a starting lineup of New Yorkers, the undefeated Tarheels beat a Kansas team led by Wilt Chamberlain in triple overtime to win the 1957 N.C.A.A. championship.
dc:creator: Richard Goldstein
media:description: Lennie Rosenbluth in 1957, the year he led North Carolina to an N.C.A.A. championship. He was in the vanguard of a player pipeline from New York City to North Carolina orchestrated by coach Frank McGuire, who had coached St. Johnâ€™s.
